summary: This document is a series of emails from December 13, 2018, between law enforcement officials, likely from the FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and an Assistant United States Attorney. The emails discuss investigative steps regarding Jeffrey Epstein's sex offender registration, specifically analyzing a phone number and addresses (St. Marks Place and 301 E. 66th Street in New York) linked to him and his associate Les Wexner's company, The Limited. The search of the St. Marks Place apartment reveals it generated thousands of records, including individuals with foreign passports of varying ages.

events.title: Investigation into Epstein's SORNA registration details
events.description: Law enforcement officials exchange emails analyzing a phone number and addresses (St. Marks Place, 301 E. 66th Street) listed on Jeffrey Epstein's sex offender registration, finding connections to Les Wexner's company and evidence of many individuals, including foreign passport holders, associated with the addresses.

locations: St. Marks Place, New York, NY 10003
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's sex offender registration listed a phone number subscribed to someone other than himself and linked to a St. Marks Place apartment associated with The Limited, a company owned by Les Wexner.

A search of the St. Marks Place apartment address 'generated thousands of records,' including 'individuals with foreign passports entering the country' with ages ranging 'from teenagers to adults to seniors.'
Another address of interest, 301 E. 66th Street, is described as a property owned at least in part by Epstein and where 'models for Mc2 may have been provided housing.'

The correspondence is between an Assistant United States Attorney and the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force, indicating an active federal investigation into Epstein in December 2018.
